meanings.definition: To remove solder from (a joint or connection)
meanings.sent1: I had to unsolder the wires to fix the broken connection.
meanings.sent2: The technician carefully unsoldered the old components to replace them.
meanings.sent3: When the robot tried to unsolder itself, it ended up in a tangled mess!
meanings.sent4: She unsoldered the friendship, leaving behind only memories.
meanings.sent5: The sun's heat was so intense that it seemed to unsolder the metal joints.

meanings.definition: To separate or disconnect by removing solder
meanings.sent1: He used a soldering iron to unsolder the two metal pieces.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to unsolder the pipes to access the broken valve.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved unsoldering the rings and then rejoining them.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seemed to unsolder the fence posts from the ground.
meanings.sent5: The artist's delicate touch was able to unsolder the sculpture without damaging it.
